intro: Rissoa, commonly known as the "buttercup," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Fabaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, yellow or orange flowers that often resemble those of the true buttercup. Rissoa species are typically found in moist, temperate regions and are often used in traditional medicine. They have compound leaves and produce legume pods that contain seeds. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for ornamental purposes.
